item.title: Microbial Growth Quantification
item.description:
Table of Contents
  1. Introduction
  2. Computational preparations
    1. Python packages
    2. Filesystem & parameters
    3. Data import
    4. Data selection
  3. Growth Laws and Substrate Uptake
    1. Exponential Growth Law
    2. Logistic Growth/Verhulst Equation
    3. Calculating Substrate Uptake Rate
    4. Libraries
  4. Data loading and variables setup
    1. Data selection
    2. Growth rate and substrate uptake rates
    3. Export parameters to configuration file
  5. Calculation of growth rate sensitivity to substrate uptake

Introduction

Microorganisms growth by converting carbon substrates to biomass and side products. The conversion process during metabolism is unique for each organism and in each condition and leads to a range of growth rates and yields of biomass from substrate. For biotechnological purposes it is important to know the growth rates, biomass yields and side products in order to effectively plan fermentations.

item.title: Dr.-Ing. Ulf Liebal
item.description: Ulf loves to learn more about microorganisms and to code the knowledge into virtual cell models. His goal is to make data analysis easy, so that a data leads quickly to insight.
